name: Jeanne Ferrante
content: Jeanne Ferrante's Home Page Jeanne Ferrante Professor Emerita, Computer Science and Engineering 9500 Gilman Drive, Mail Stop 0404 The University of California, San Diego La Jolla, CA 92093-0404 USA Short bio "The Italian Scholar", painting by Kim Itkonen Contact Information Mail Code CSE Email CSE Office Hours MC 0404 jferrante@ucsd.edu By appointment, via email Compiler technology provides the necessary interface between programming languages and architectures, and as such is intimately tied to new developments in both. Jeanne Ferrante's work has centered on the development of compiler technology, with particular interest in exploiting parallelism and optimizing data movement to achieve high performance. Resume Classes UCSD Global TIES (Teams In Engineering Service) An academic program initiated in fall, 2004 that partners multidisciplinary student teams with non-profit organizations in the local and global community Students, sign up for MentorNet Women's Leadership Alliance IS NO LONGER ACTIVE Women In Computing Here are some pictures from WIC lunches at the CUPS coffee cart, and the Grace Hopper Celebration, 2006. Faculty Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at UC San Diego Jeanneology Pictures from my Leave/Sabbatical Academic Year 2000-01 ``Life is very short, and there's no time For fussing and fighting, my friend.'' from We Can Work It Out, by John Lennon and Paul Mc Cartney jferrante@ucsd.edu
